item.title: Test 2 Questions
item.description: This test is designed to take one hour. Complete it during the class period. Tests submitted by 10:10 AM on May 19 will be on time. Submit through the upload link at the course Blackboard site > Tests > Test 2. Instructions Choose six (6) of the questions below under “Questions” to work on. For each of those six questions, write a one-paragraph answer, not shorter than five sentences. For most, 6–7 sentences is a good range to aim for, in terms of length (though sentences vary in terms of content, of course, and very brief sentences may not convey as much as I’m assuming in my estimate).

item.title: Interpreting Grades
item.description: This note about grading and interpreting grades just adds some detail to what the course syllabus already says about grading. 4-point scale Grades in this course are assigned and calculated using Hofstra’s 4-point scale (described here in the Hofstra Bulletin). Following the Bulletin, the alphabetical grades, including plus (+) and minus (–), have the following 4-point scale values (and vice versa): letter 4pt Student’s academic performance … A 4.
